Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Investigates the theoretical, historical and ideological ideas in architecture that took place during the early decades of the twentieth century.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles of structural behavior in withstanding gravity and lateral forces. Considers structural layout, load distribution, and preliminary design techniques; and examines contemporary structural systems through case studies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Social, political, material, technological, and cultural forces on design and construction from 1850, including architect's role in civil society and theoretical positions of architects and architectural schools.

Course Description.text: Principles and practices relating to control of the thermal/atmospheric environment and plumbing in buildings.

Course Description.text: Architecture designs focus on architectural detail and articulation. An investigation of landscape provides the context for this study.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Control over architectural processes to solve design needs through appropriate program development and construction technology. Complete building as a final product, emphasizing on urban and suburban housing projects.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Architectural design with a large scale urban context. Theory, methodology, and evolution of urban form in response to social, cultural, economic and technological forces.
